results.title: Feathers and Fools
results.brief_description: Based on a short story by Mem Fox. This is a parable about two groups of birds - swans and peacocks - who are greatly afraid of their respective differences.

results.title: Feast of St. Isidore and The Horrors of war (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Luciano Emmer, Sergio Amidei and Colonna Film
results.brief_description: This film is more that a record of Goya’s work; it is also an interpretation of the philosophy of the man himself. Two sharply differing aspects are depicted: in “The Feast of St Isidore” Goya sketched the festivities in Madrid, the excitement of the bullfight and the mixed adoration and fear in the faces of the people at the evening procession of the Virgin; in “The Horrors of War” Goya depicted all the cruelty, fear and violence of the Napoleonic invasion and the grief and pain which followe it. The film concludes with a vision of drawings showing the sadness and futility of human existence.

results.title: Fear woman
results.creator_credit: Elspeth MacDougall and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: A documentary about the status of women in Ghana, noting their reputation for independence. Points out that the women run a large part of the retail trade of the country, and that they are beginning to enter into areas which have power and influence.

results.title: Fats
results.creator_credit: Michael Coyle and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Home Economics”.
This film stresses the correlation between heart disease and the consumption of fats and oils in the diet. Outlines ways in which the amount of fat and oil in the diet can be reduced.

results.title: Fathers of pop
results.creator_credit: Julian Cooper, Rodney Wilson and Arts Council of Great Britain
results.brief_description: London in the 1950’s saw the beginnings of a ferment from which “the London Pop Scene” emerged in the sixties. Said to have begun with the Independent Group at the Institute of Contemporary Arts, one of its members at the time, Reyner Benham, reconstructs some of the events, attitudes and influences of the time and discusses with the survivors how it was then and how it looks now.

results.title: Fathers
results.creator_credit: Antonio Colacino, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Discusses the role of the father in contemporary society. Previously the daily care of children was seen to be the mother’s responsibility, but an increasing number of fathers are now taking the primary responsibility for the care of their children. This active involvement by both parents with their children, could benefit all family members.
